  3560. />1) Start the warmer on high, but as soon as the wax has a 0.25&#34; ring of melted wax around it, flip the remainder unmelted wax, and turn the warmer down to low.

  1. Absolutely terrible. I purchased it not having ever heard of &#34;hard wax&#34; versus what my salon uses. Tried legs first and it was messy and difficult to work with...and patchy.   3. It took me a while. To get used to this, just because I've never waxed before, but I love it. It works great. It does take a while to warm up, but that's to be expected because it is a hard wax. I'll definitely be using this more in the future. Definitely recommend.
  4. Works great!   7. I definitely love this product. I went to a well known wax place in town. It was my first visit ever and liked the result of my full Brazilian wax.   8. This works great for our purposes, which so far has been facial hair. It is MUCH better than any wax you buy in the store. It's just like going to a salon, only cheaper.   9. By far the worst purchase I ever made on Amazon.<br /><br />I ordered this several months ago - The package was damaged, and the upper lid was in pieces. Amazon promptly agreed to pay the entire price. However, since it was just the lid that was broken, I rejected the full refund, and only asked to be compensated for the lid.<br />So far so good.<br /><br />Then I set out to use it. It took hours and hours to heat, and when I actually started to use it, it stuck to my skin and hardened. I ended up with red spots all over my skin. It did not satisfy its purpose at all. Created mess all over, and wouldn't come out from clothes even after soaking them in hot water.
  10. I wish I could rate more than 5 stars. This product is everything it says it is. I have only gotten soft waxed once. This is my first time hard waxing and I must say I had a pleasant experience. I waxed my own bikini line as well as my underarms. the process is so easy and clean. I watched the dvd this came with which was a great help! I also read the instructions. If you do that, you will be just fine. You don't have to be an expert to use it.   12. I never write reviews. Ever.<br /><br />That being said, I was super nervous about waxing my own bikini line. No one likes ripping out their own hair. But my hair is dark and coarse and even when I go somewhere to have my eyebrows waxed they charge me extra. When I shave, it felt smooth but I still have dark little dots everywhere. So I decided to try hard waxing at home to save money and feel a bit more confident in my bikini.<br /><br />The kit arrived two days earlier than my delivery date. I set aside a few hours, took like 3 Tylenol and a hot shower and exfoliated. I also made sure to drink a lot of water throughout the day.<br /><br />I let the wax heat up for about 20 minutes on high. Figuring out the right temp to apply and rip is key. I found it only took a few seconds once on the skin. Also, watch some hard waxing videos on YouTube. It helped a lot.<br /><br />It hurt much less than getting my brows waxed. So much less that I gave myself the full &#34;treatment&#34; the first time out! I kind of used the whole can. But I did my legs, my bikini, my nether regions and even did my boyfriend's downstairs. He's a trooper. Plus he wanted to see what the fuss was about. I feel so good down there. Like a brand new gal! And three days later, it's smooth sailin! I will totally buy another couple of cans

  19. I've been getting full Brazilians for years - living in SoCal for so long its sort of a requirement. Since this is so common there it is inexpensive to get it done. Boy was I in for a rude awakening when I moved to D.C. The women must just stay hairy here because a Brazilian will set you back upwards of $65 and that's without the butt strip! YOUCH! I found very few places that used the hard wax I preferred - the wax with strips leaving me with major ingrown hair. In desperation I turned to amazon to see if there was such a thing as at home waxing. Enter this GiGi kit.<br /><br />First - my kit came complete and everything worked. No broken parts, spilled bottles, etc. All good. It was easy to set up - but did take much longer to get the wax hot than it said (took me almost an hour). Once it got hot I put it on Low for 15 minutes and was ready to start.<br /><br />Second - this stuff is MESSY. Very very messy - at least when doing a Brazilian by yourself. While some areas were very simple others were nearly impossible - and clumps of hair were the most difficult to get effectively - especially as the journey took me further down and under. It took 1/2 the container to do a full Brazilian including the butt strip part (and surrounding area). Unfortunately this wax sticks something terrible. About mid way through I switched from the oil provided to baby powder (which is what my wax lady uses) and that was markedly better. Still the under area was a real bear to do. The heat level of the warmer was just right and I had no issues. No ingrowns that I can see - and very smooth areas after wax. In terms of pain I'm a masochist so it didn't bother me much at all.<br /><br />Third - my lessons learned. Make sure you hold the skin taut - it just doesn't work if you don't. Do put the wax on in the direction of hair but NEVER stop wax in a group of hair...you will be sorry. Try talcum or baby power instead of the oil if that doesn't work as well as you want. Put a big towel outyou don't care about as it's gonna get wrecked. WEAR GLOVES - you will thank me later. Use smaller sticks in areas you cannot see - better to do smaller bits at a time than big globs that get stuck. Don't wait too long to pull it off or it glops up and you cannot get it off. Use the cooling gel after - It really did help.<br /><br />Good luck! Overall I am VERY happy with this kit. I am saving about $65-100 a visit using this even with the warmer cost. Well worth it!

  51. The warmer itself is pretty good, I leave it for maybe 40 minutes on High to Medium heat to completely melt the wax. It also comes with some handy sticks, varying in different sizes to spread the wax, pre-waxing oil and cooling gel (for after) and a CD. I feel like the oil is pretty useless, though. Just make sure the area is clean, put on some baby powder and get to waxing.<br /><br />This wax doesn't require the muslin strips. Apply it, it hardens and then you pull it off. Make sure you apply this wax on kind of thick. Or else it will be hard to lift the corner to pull. The first time, I pinched my skin on accident a lot and ended up with like a billion bruises :(<br /><br />WARNING: Wax in general can be pretty messy. If this is your first time or you're inexperienced, I recommend doing this on a non-carpeted floor, like bathroom and lay down an old towel/paper underneath you. And have baby oil ready for clean up.<br /><br />Overall thoughts, this kit has been the best investment I've ever made. Your legs, underarms, face and bikini area will be smooth and thankful (: I love my gigi wax warmer👍💕

  56. Love Love Love! Face it ladies. As we get older and the hormones start bouncing around, hair starts growing where it isn't supposed to! I suggest playing with some on your forefinger tip and thumb. You can feel when it starts to get sticky and get an idea of the proper consistency and thickness. Spread on kind of thick and pull the applicator away from your skin at the end so it leaves an edge to grab on to. Start small till you get the hang of it. Just so you know, I have very sensitive skin and it didn't bother me at all, just a little redness...I think bandaids hurt more! I took my time and twirled the applicator with wax on it like a cotton candy and made no mess at all. I did put down an old towel just in case, cause accidents happen. The oil helps too but I don't plan on buying more when it is gone. I will use coconut oil. The gel seems to have some lidocaine or something in it that sort oil numbs the area a little. But like I said, it didn't really hurt at all. Just don't psych yourself out! I am very happy and satisfied with this product.   65. This is a fantastic waxing kit. However, no matter what you do, at home waxing is not for the faint at heart. Do see a professional, at least once before you attempt this to get an idea of how they apply/remove the wax. And be prepared to spend some time at this if its your first rodeo! My first attempt alone took me 3 whole hours. THREE HOURS. And eventually I wussed out and now I'm left with a random patch up top that looks silly. BUT seriously, three whole hours of ripping hardened wax and hair off your lady bits will come to that at times. Take some OTC pain medication about 45-30 mins before you start the process. DO use the oil, and if you have baby powder (or corn starch in a pinch) lightly dust that on as well. It helps so the wax only sticks to the hair and not your skin, also helps to remove and moisture. DO wax in the direction of the hair growth, always pull wax off in the opposite direction of the hair growth or you're just going to end up ripping hair and not ripping it out. Not a pleasant experience. All in all, it does what you need it to do. Just be prepared, waxing hurts, no matter what you do.

  93. The biggest problem with this wax is that it has to be JUST THE RIGHT temperature at any given time.<br /><br />If it's too hot when you apply it, it burns.<br />If it's too cool when you apply it, it doesn't spread well/evenly, and doesn't adhere to anything.<br /><br />If it's too hot when you try and pull it off, it just stretches and pulls painfully<br />If it's too cool when you try and pull it off, it just breaks instead of pulling off in one strip<br /><br />Great for professionals I'm sure, but I much prefer to just use the premade waxing strips you can buy. Plus with those, you can rub ice cubes over the area right before you pull it off to numb the pain. Faster, less messy, and less painful. Not to mention less chance of burning yourself or getting wax everywhere.
  94. Freaking painful and doesn't freaking work! Totally bummed I made more of a freaking mess than I did pull out hairs.
  95. Bought it to use for my eyebrows and it's working perfectly!!!
  96. Great product that makes at -home waxing as easy as it can be. This wax is the best for bikini waxing that I have found. The whole kit is a great deal for the price.
  97. The kit is beautifully packaged, arrived within only three days. I had watched several youtube videos on waxing prior to receiving package. It comes with a DVD, but my player wasn't working at the moment. So, after viewing those, I felt like an expert. Didn't order all the special stuff to go with it - you simply don't need it. Baby oil your face, blot dry. Lightly dust face with baby powder, and you're ready to wax. Put wax on IN DIRECTION of hair growth (get a little magnifying mirror to put on regular mirror). Wax only needs to stay on slightly over 60 seconds. You want it somewhat soft and pliable. Keeping wax strip close to face, quickly remove it in opposite direction (against hair growth direction). There was absolutely no pain, except a bit of discomfort right under my nose. It worked like a dream. Only thing was I had a rash next day. Used once again, and one application of walmart brand hydrocortisone ointment right afterward stopped rash cold. Excellent results. Only sorry I wasn't doing this the last 30 years. It's easy and NOT messy at all. Just like frosting a cake.
  98. I like this hard wax. I am an amateur, and only wax myself, but this wax worked well on areas with course hair. I liked that it didn't require strips, as I felt like this was less waste. I felt like it did take a while to get the full pot of wax warm enough for use.<br /><br />I would still buy this if I hadn't started making my own sugar based hair removal product now.
  99. The whole product is very nice and useful, I just wasn't thrilled that when I got my package the Pre-Epilation Oil was partially opened and spilled all over the box. Smeared the writing completely off the warmer. Still worked great, but lets keep the stuff we pay for in the container because the returns can sure be a hassle.

  133. Let me just tell you about my experience and I'll let you decide whether or not this is worth your money. As noted by others, it does take longer than 30 minutes for the wax to melt. It took about an hour for me, but I usually go off and do something else as I wait for it to heat up. The wax can get extremely hot, so I would advise you to slightly rotate your wax on the waxing stick or blow on it to cool it off before applying. Using the pre-epilator cream helped a lot in regards to making sure the wax didn't stick to my skin. I was also pleased to see that the wax grabbed onto some hairs I couldn't pull out with my tweezers. Considering we are all different, I can't guarantee this will work for you, but I plan on keeping my kit. :)

  141. Second Updated Review<br /><br />The wax itself is very good! It pulls almost every single hair on the first application. It typically takes a second application to completely remove every bit.<br /><br />The first pull/tug was the hardest. My...it was painful, despite the oil and pulling the skin tightly. Even after bathing with warm water to open up the pores a little. I've noticed that the pain tolerance may have gone up some toward the end. Keep at it ladies. It does get easier. :)<br /><br />Prep your area by trimming down to about 1/4 - 1/2 inch. Any longer and it may be even more painful. And the worst thing is that the wax may not stick properly.<br /><br />Definitely wear gloves. I had tile floors in the bathroom so it was a breeze to clean up. If you have carpet, use newspaper or a towel to cover the floor. It will get messy.<br /><br />The warmer does take time to melt the wax. Give about 15 mins on high then lower to medium for about 5 mins then lower it to the lowest setting for 10 minutes before applying the wax on your skin. Test it first on the back of your hand. Apply again direction of hair growth. The wax should not be too runny and start to dry almost immediately on your skin. Don't let it harden. It should be soft to the touch but not sticky. Tug on the edge with the stick then pull the strip the opposite direction of the hair growth.<br /><br />UPDATED REVIEW<br /><br />I had to request a replacement. The oil seeped through and ruined everything in the box. The warmer did not light up when plugged in. I waited for the light to turn on, thinking it may take a few minutes, but the red nor the green turned on after 15 minutes. I thought it may be my outlet so I tried two more outlets with the same result. Frustrating.<br /><br />The replacement is expected to arrive Thursday, August 1st. I'm hoping against hope that I will be getting a clean box.<br /><br />***<br />ORIGINAL REVIEW<br /><br />Very upset! Just like some reviewers, I received an empty bottle of the Pre-Epilating Oil because the cap was not screwed tightly and it was not even pressed down. The oil leaked through the GIGI production box. It also leaked through the Amazon box. Why was it not wrapped or sealed?<br /><br />I have not used the product yet and will not use it until I get a complimentary bottle of the Pre-Epilating Oil. I've sent a message to Amazon regarding the packaging so hopefully they will respond shortly. The rating may change to a max of FOUR Stars should the wax exceeds my expectation. The spillage has deducted a star from the overall rating.ty bottle of the Pre-Epilating Oil because the cap was not screwed tightly and it was not even pressed down.   145. I waited to try it a few times until I gave a review. There's definitely a happy medium for the wax temperature. Too cold and it's hard to manage. That's easy to determine and just needs to be heated a little longer. It's harder to tell if it's too hot. You want to be able to take a good amount of wax out with the applicator. If it's too hot, the wax will just run off and cause a mess. It will also likely be uncomfortably hot on the skin. After learning how to get the temperature right, it was actually pretty easy to use and worked great. The reason I gave 4 stars was because there doesn't seem to be a low enough setting to keep the wax warm once it's melted. It takes a long time for it to heat up. Like other comments I've read, I try to notice when the outside is melted and the inside is still solid and then turn it to the lowest setting. But it will still eventually get hot. Sometimes you just might want to leave it be and comeback when it's all melted. Turning it off works but takes longer for it to cool. I found that removing the metal container worked better for bringing it down to the temperature I want. It's hot so I wouldn't recommend using your fingers.
  146. hard to use unless you are a professional

  148. I got this a few months ago and have used it at least 10 times since then and I absolutely love it! It is so much more cost effective to wax my own legs, etc. than to go to a service provider every time. This wax warmer is incredibly simple to use, heats up very quickly, and is easy to clean. I do not use any pre-epi oils/lotions/powders and my skin does fine with that, but some people may find it necessary to take some extra precautions. Also, this warmer get VERY hot so be certain that your wax is at a safe temperature before using it. I use an aloe lotion after waxing as opposed to any of the post-epi specific products. My favorite wax is the All Purpose Honee, it goes on easily and lasts for a long time. Hard wax does hurt less than strip wax, but the results are cleaner (as in no leftover hair OR wax on the skin) with strip wax, so if you can handle that, I recommend using a wax with muslin strips instead.

  161. OK, being a guy I've never waxed anything and I've never shaved anything other than my face for the most part. My wife wanted this kit so she could do an at home Brazilian. According to the DVD that comes with it she did the Full Brazilian and I got a Sphinx. I've never waxed anyone before and the instructions were very easy to understand. Her waxing went painlessly as I used a good bit of wax and went PAST the patches of hair I could get a grip on the wax WITHOUT pulling the initial few hairs individually. After you rip the wax off you have to apply pressure to the area to slightly relieve the pain. As I stated before her waxing went flawless and painless. She wanted to practice so I volunteered somewhat reluctantly and let her try it out. 3 Things to remember: 1) You have to wax PAST the hair to make a grip 2) apply PRESSURE after you rip the hair away 3) make sure you pull with enough force to rip it in ONE shot. My wife did not do any of those 3 simultaneously so I am not ready to ever let her wax me again. She on the other hand loves the results and is more than happy to let me wax her again and is looking forward to it. I contemplated payback but I like the results too and I love the view when I get to wax her.<br /><br />If you're a guy, WATCH THE DVD AND DO IT RIGHT! You'll thank me later! :)<br /><br />It's been two weeks since and there is little to no hair growth still. Be sure you have tweezers to get the few strays that have awesome root in your skin (yes, there will be a few tough ones). Other than that, you might want to get the spill sleeves. It comes with only one. It's so you don't get the warmer all waxed up. Very great purchase overall. Much much cheaper than going to a spa and getting it done. Good luck!

  185. This is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! I did receive the product damaged (the lid was shattered) but, amazon quickly refunded me some of the cost (I think like $11 or so) which was nice. I have this warmer set up right on my counter in the bathroom. The actual hard wax is so nice to wax with as it hurts a lot LESS than wax with the strips you place over. It is really nice! The hard wax does not adhere to your skin and pull your skin – it pulls the hairs only. A lot of people complain about this being ‘messy’ but, once you get the hang of it, it isn’t messy anymore! Here are a few tips:<br />- Set a paper towel or cloth down underneath your warmer and around the counter you will be waxing by, also on the ground in case you do drip<br /> the wax… it makes for easier clean up!<br />- Plug the warmer in about 20 minutes prior to waxing<br />- Put on rubber gloves for the first few wax sessions – until you get the hang of it and you do not require them anymore. This makes clean up<br /> WAY easier<br />- Have everything set out prior to starting (your before and after lotion, tweezers, scissors if needed, your popsicle sticks, some cotton balls or<br /> cloth to apply the after oil/lotion)<br />- After the wax is completely melted – set the warmer to ‘warm’ and let it cool down for about 10 minutes. YOU DO NOT WANT THE WAX<br /> TO BE RUNNY!!! If it is, it will be really messy and more than likely burn your skin. You want the wax to be a little thinner than honey! =)<br /><br />If you follow the above steps, your process will be that much easier.

  205. So glad I ordered this! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the lid came cracked, but it doesn't bother me enough to send it back. The wax warmer is a life saver, it keeps the wax at the perfect temperature. The wax comes off very easily and doesn't stick to skin like soft wax does. Learning to wax at home (especially the bikini area) is for sure a learning experience and it will take a while to really get it down. On that note, here's some advice:<br /><br />-Watch the DVD (and some youtube videos), and if you can get professionally waxed at least once. Watch them carefully and notice all the little tricks they have.<br /><br />-It's going to be messy, especially the first time. I sat on my bathroom floor with an old hand mirror (I got wax all over it) and a sheet on the floor. Keep the trash can nearby for your applicator sticks.<br /><br />-Whether you use the oil the kit comes with or baby powder (I use powder because it's what they use at my waxing place), don't skimp. The wax won't really adhere to skin but it will come off much easier with the oil/powder.<br /><br />-Hold your skin as taut as possible when pulling the wax off. If your skin is not taut, the wax wont come off cleanly. I had to experiment with positions for the more delicate areas.<br /><br />-Less is more! Keep the wax as thin as possible while still covering all the hair. It actually grabs more hair that way and is way easier to remove. If your wax is too thick the top will be too cool and the bottom will still be sticky, so it will break and be stringy at the same time when you try to remove it.<br /><br />The first time you use this kit it will be messy and imperfect. But $45 for probably at least 6 months worth of waxing (probably closer to a year) is a great bargain. Be patient, have fun, and happy waxing!

  230. I bought the kit after reading the reviews many times (good and bad) but I figured I'd have to try it myself to really have an opinion and being so sick of shaving I just went for it and order it on April 20, 2015 Sold by: Think Fast...wanted to try it several times before writing a review...I can tell you, this is my new best friend!! It is very easy to use, instructions are clear but I also looked on youtube for a how to use video here (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DNdVkvixtcc). This was also my first time with hard wax and doing it myself. I started with my underarms and got them done in 45 mins and now I'm down to 30mins. This really pulls the hair from its roots, at the end, only some very thin, hard to get hairs are left which I pull with the tweezers, like they show in the video, and then apply the cooling gel. It also worked beautifully in my bikini area. Now, I wax once a week to keep myself clean and smooth ;) Some people in other reviews mentioned that the wax was green but mine was a honey color and there was nothing strange with it. Tips based on my experience: - of course, do wax after the shower when skin is clean and hair is soft. - apply the wax and pull it after 1 min or so. It would be hard enough to trap the hair but flexible enough to pull. If you leave it too long it would be too hard and it will start breaking into pieces instead of coming all at once, it will be painful to take the pieces off. - don't apply a very thin layer of wax, I found it grabbed more hair if the layer was a little thicker (not too thick, you'll have to find what works best for you) Hope it works for you...

  245. I purchased the Gigi Brazilian waxing kit after trying their microwave Brazilian bikini hard wax thinking that the products would be similar but they were not. This formula has a thinner consistency which made application a little tricky. I'm new to waxing at home so someone with more experience may have an easier time with it. I was able to get the wax to work better by setting my warmer to low for the entire melting process and applying 2 to 3 coats on area to be waxed. I found that 2 coats often resulted in torn strips that were more painful to pull than thicker ones. On the other hand, the thinner consistency allowed me to &#34;cheat&#34; a few times and use wax strips for harder to reach areas.<br />This kit comes with Gigi's pre-hon as well as pre epilation oil. I loved both products and would purchase them again separately in future. To remove excess wax, I used my coconut oil and jumped back in the shower for final removal. Overall, this was a great value buy since the warmer alone costs the same amount as the entire kit at local brick and mortar stores. I will continue to look for a hard wax with a thicker consistency to use with my warmer.

  267. I ordered this kit on a whim and am so glad that I did. I had never tried waxing before but was sick of my other methods of hair removal, specifically in the armpit area as I was always getting razor burn.<br /><br />After just a couple of uses I can already tell that I'm getting more adept at this system. Here are a few of my observations:<br /><br />I turn on the system in the middle of the day on high and let it heat up (the time this takes varies depending upon how much wax you have left in the can). When it's quite runny I turn it on low and wait until it thickens a bit to start the process.<br /><br />The collars are a must so keep some extras on hand. They are a great place to lay the applicator while you're waiting for the wax to dry and they also keep your machine from being draped in wax by the end of a session.<br /><br />I find that the larger paddles are the best for me as the bigger the swath of wax I can apply at once = larger area of hair removed.<br /><br />To the person who said to start on the &#34;outskirts&#34; where there is no hair: THANK YOU. This is the truth. Start the wax out a bit past the hair line so you can lift up an edge and get the &#34;tear away&#34; process started before the real hairs are pulled up.<br /><br />Sometimes pulling against the growth of the hair isn't what's going to get the hairs out (especially true in the armpit area) so wait a few moments, reapply the wax and try again, pulling they wax in the opposite direction, if you see that the hair didn't come out the first time.<br /><br />If you have gel nails, USE GLOVES. This stuff can wreck gel polish and probably regular polish too. I use medical latex gloves and they work fine. If you do get some gel on your polish, wait until it dries before trying to pick it off.<br /><br />I found that the first time I do an area is the most painful. The armpits were THE WORST. But every subsequent time has been less painful. Also the hair seems to grow in softer so maybe that's why.<br /><br />If there is any residual wax left it will pick up the colors of the clothing fibers you wear. For instance if you do your bikini line and wear black undies and PJ pants that night, the residual wax will be black the next day. Worth mentioning if you do the wax one day and are expecting to be seen naked that night...<br /><br />I am medium skin toned and have only slightly sensitive skin and I get a considerable amount of red, bubbled up skin after a waxing session. By the next morning it has lessened greatly and it's gone within two days time. Again worth mentioning if you intend to be seen naked that night...<br /><br />Any residual wax does come off on its own after a couple of days time and a couple of showers.<br /><br />Overall this kit has been great. I recently tried waxing my upper lip and it worked just fine there too. Will keep buying replacement cans!of the clothing fibers you wear. For instance if you do your bikini line and wear black undies and PJ pants that night, the residual wax will be black the next day. Worth mentioning if you do the wax one day and are expecting to be seen naked that night... I am medium skin toned and have only slightly sensitive skin and I get a considerable amount of red, bubbled up skin after a waxing session. By the next morning it has lessened greatly and it's gone within two days time. Again worth mentioning if you intend to be seen naked that night... Any residual wax does come off on its own after a couple of days time and a couple of showers. Overall this kit has been great. I recently tried waxing my upper lip and it worked just fine there too. Will keep buying replacement cans!
  268. This product is overall a good one. I've never waxed before so I tried it on myself and my guy also took his turn on me. Personally I find the DVD useless (unless you're starting up a business and not just using this for home use), I ended up looking up a tutorial on youtube and found this one to be very helpful [...]<br /><br />The wax itself takes about an hour to get melted and warm so be prepared for that (it comes in a metal container so microwaving isn't an option like I'd hoped). Also if you want to do large areas, this may not be the best choice. The waxing strips seem to be the better way to go because application of hard wax pieces is time consuming (esp if you're a rookie like me) and not all the hairs come out... however with time and practice it will work well :)<br /><br />The kit comes as pictured with a ton of application sticks as well as the oil and post application lotion. When I got my kit the cap on the oil was partly unscrewed and half of the oil was in the box O_O<br /><br />The warmer itself works well and once you're wax is melted its best to put it on medium and stir the wax a bit so you don't get the \\"molten lava\\" effect that another reviewer was talking about (unless yours is as defective as hers was...)<br /><br />Overall its a neat little kit and it functions as it should. I'd give it 5 stars since I know a lot of its issues are likely the cause of my rookie mistakes but the useless DVD, the open bottle of oil and the long wait time for the wax to heat up makes this a 4 star product in my book.

  270. The plastic lid was already cracked
  271. I really wanted to like this waxing kit -- in fact, I liked it a lot when I first got it and used it. The warmer works well, the wax tore off tons of hair once I watched the video a few times and got the technique down.<br /><br />About 3 hours later, however, I was in allergic contact dermatitis hell.<br /><br />If you get skin irritation, rashes, welts, etc. from bandaids, plasters, bandage adhesive, medical tape, or whatever else is similar, or rosin, colophony, etc., do NOT use the Brazilian Hard Body Wax that comes with this!<br /><br />I get bad rashes and angry, red, raised welts from most self-stick bandages and medical tape. I had no idea that usually the culprit is the sticky rosin or colophony that causes the reaction. That also happens to be the #1 ingredient in this hard wax. :(<br /><br />Luckily as a waxing noobie, I only practiced a little on 1 leg and then did both underarms and a bit on one side of my face before I got tired. If I'd have gone for the gusto with an actual brazilian, I'd probably be writing this from the hospital. My entire face turned red, hot, and itchy, including my ears, behind my ears, and some of my neck. My armpits are mostly flaring around the edges -- where the hair was thickest and my skin the wrinkliest was luckily spared. My leg took a day to break out in a rash, but now I've got lots of mottled skin, red marks, and pinpricks that are probably from scratching.<br /><br />If you wind up reacting to this wax, my advice is to self-medicate with Benadryl internally and hydrocortisone 1% topically. I kept myself in a self-indued semi-coma, sleeping the better part of 2 days with the help of Benadryl. I applied hydrocortisone to all irritated areas 4 times a day (sometimes more, if it was really itchy.) There are creams, sprays, liquid rollerballs, and cooling hydrocortisone forumlas -- I've been using various combinations of all 4 to keep my scratching to a minimum.<br /><br />I'll be proceeding to an allergist and/or dermatologist as soon as I can get someone to fit me in. Until then, I'll be hoping Gigi makes a rosin-free hard wax, and staying away from people since I look blotchy, am still hairy, and smell horrible. :( Hopefully my experience can help others avoid the same fate.<br /><br />Gigi -- PLEASE start putting a disclaimer on your product that people with adhesive or rosin allergies should not use this stuff! I watched the video and read the booklet and had no idea what I was in for until it was too late and I was googling to figure out whether or not to go to the ER.ogist as soon as I can get someone to fit me in. Until then, I'll be hoping Gigi makes a rosin-free hard wax, and staying away from people since I look blotchy, am still hairy, and smell horrible. :( Hopefully my experience can help others avoid the same fate.<br /><br />Gigi -- PLEASE start putting a disclaimer on your product that people with adhesive or rosin allergies should not use this stuff! I watched the video and read the booklet and had no idea what I was in for until it was too late and I was googling to figure out whether or not to go to the ER.

  315. the package came after 2 days thanks to amazon prime! I received this product today and everything looks perfectly fine except when I opened the package with all the products inside, there was a post epilation lotion and post wax cooling gel. In the product description, it says that this product should come with pre epilation oil not the post epilation lotion. I think its important to have the pre epilation oil so that it doesn't hurt my skin. it took me an hour to finish waxing and I was in a LOT of pain doing it. The products works well. The only thing that you have to remember is not to put too much or too little wax. When you put too much it sticks so well in your hair and make it harder to pull. So i kinda of hesitate to pull my hairs and that made it so difficult to get the wax off since it already sticked into my skin so hard. What i did is to cut those wax full of hairs using a small nose scissors and it worked just fine. Also you have to keep the heater to medium to keep the wax in good temperature which I found working its best when its in medium temp. When you apply the wax, follow the direction of your hair line. DO NOT apply the wax on the opposite direction as it will be very messy when it dries, making it hard to pull the corner of the wax. However, when you pull, pull from the opposite direction of how your hair grows because when you don't, you will lose skin and bleed. Waxing yourself is definitely not an easy task, as its messy, it hurts your neck and it takes guts to take the pain. do not hesitate when pulling, pull quickly and hard! For the excess hairs, its helpful to plaque it out using tweezers. For excess wax, its really easy to clean it up specially if you used a baby oil. after putting the baby oil and cleaning the wax residue,clean the surface area with dry cloth to get the excess oil then apply the post cooling gel which helps a lot. When you find your area in pain, slap the painful area and pain will disappear. After doing all this,I must say that all the hard work paid it off. My skin is smooth as baby's skin no hairs and no bumps. This product works, you just need to learn to use a proper techniques and of course a lot of patience or else just go to salon and have a professional do it for you.<br /><br />Thanks.

  337. I REALLY want to love this product. In fact, I would go so far as to say it is better than any other Brazilian-waxing kit you can get from your brick and mortar grocery store. I have tried many other products before, and while it does better than the others I have tried, I will say this: if you are looking for a full-body waxing kit, this product will not do. (I'll get back to this in a minute.) While I do not claim to be a professional aesthetician, I do find that despite people's insistence that hard wax is the best for waxing (and maybe it is), it does leave me wanting. (And I do recommend you have someone else do the waxing for you, it is SOOO much easier for them to reach places for you; it's a fact.) I have used this product about 5 times now and while I am getting better at using it now, but even still, I can't help but think: Is there no wax that can harden up and peel better?<br /><br />If you are a busy person with not much time on your hands, this is not for you. It also takes a REALLY long time to remove all of the hair you want gone... even small areas of skin take longer than you would think. This isn't the kind of product that you can use every morning before going in to work. I find it more timely to just shave the hair off. I had to wax in small time increments over several days just to get all the hair I wanted off. I would use this maybe every weekend.<br /><br />So does the product work? It does, but in my experience it shouldn't be used for anything other than your groin/bikini line. I don't know if my hair is sturdier than others', but I have tried waxing my armpits, chest, nipples, and around the bellybutton but it only got about half the hairs. The way I see it, this product is good for what it was intended to be used for: Brazilian waxes and nothing more. It's not really a full-body wax kit even though some people think it is. I have tried the &#34;pull in the direction opposite that the hairs are growing&#34; technique and it worked some ofthe time.<br /><br />I'll give you guys updates if I think the product is really better than I think it is at the present. Until then, keep it kind-of-ouchy. ^_^

  347. This is the BEST body wax ever! I have tried several store bought waxes before to no avail. Well, I finally stumbled upon this brand and liked it, although is not microwaveable, it is a hard wax that can be removed by hand without having to use those annoying strips. After reading the reviews I decided to buy the kit. The kit never arrived to my home although Amazon's order tracker said it did. I contacted the seller whom assured me it had been delivered; I insisted that the package was never delivered to my house, after two email exchanges the seller shipped me another kit, which this time made it home.<br /><br />A few tips:<br /><br />-Like many here have said before, apply a moisturizing oil before using the wax. Use the one that comes with the kit. If you do not have this, coconut oil, baby oil or mineral oil will do just fine. The point is to use the oil, without it you will probably have a very painful experience. With it you get a mild manageable pain/discomfort.<br /><br />- After you are done, apply a lotion something soothing for you will most likely experience slight redness. The redness will go away in a couple of hours, the important thing is to keep the skin moisturized.<br /><br />P.S. It is possible to wax large areas with this. In fact I used it on both legs the first time, it took me about an hour and 15 minutes to do both legs. I imagine next time will take less, just need patience that is all.
  348. Came broken 😔 I was bummed!
  349. This kit will most definitely sound like a great idea, especially after you calculate how much you pay for one of these procedures every 3-5 weeks. Let's keep it real, it hurts to get your pubes waxed. There is nothing you can do to avoid it. It takes practice and bravery to accomplish such a procedure solo. The wax WILL get everywhere. You WILL shed a tear. You WILL save alot of money. practice makes perfect. I suggest starting with the simple bikini wax, then see how you feel. The price of this wax kit is just fantastic. You can use other same size canned wax in it. It's just a great buy even if you only use it for underarm waxing, its a steal.

  354. Putting hot wax on your lady bits is not going to be fun. But if it keeps me from having to shave all of the time, its worth it! I'll share with you all some lessons I learned the hard (and painful) way:<br /><br />Use the oil. Seriously, just do it. I tried without and it has to be similar to giving childbirth without an epidural. Spread some oil on the area youre waxing, wipe with a towel, and then slap on some baby powder. You don't want wax stuck to your skin AND your hair. Ouch.<br /><br />This is a hard wax so you don't need to use strips to remove the wax, but its worth the $6 to buy some and make your life easier. It speeds up the waxing and saves you from trying to pull up the wax from your skin and wait for the exact dryness. Put on the wax, press a strip over top and wait maybe 5 seconds and pull. Wayyy more efficient than 30 seconds for the wax to dry fully!<br /><br />Buy some wax remover! No matter how great your technique, there will be a little left over driving you nuts.<br /><br />Hopefully this will save some hassle. Overall I am absolutely thrilled with this purchase. A great value and a great product that I plan to use for many years! My skin is smooth and not itchy from stubble- I will gladly go through the waxing once a month for these results!
  355. The wax itself is very efficient and does remove coarse hair, perfect for the area. I had no problem with the wax warmer either. The reason I am giving it four stars however, is because of my problems with the wax applicator sticks and the CD included with the kit. First, the sticks are slanted at both sides (not sure why) which makes it really difficult to apply the wax in this area. When applying wax, you have to apply a generous amount to the direction of hair growth, managing to create a little &#34;tab&#34; at the end to pull the wax off. I found that with the slanted applicator sticks, it was hard to make this &#34;tab&#34;. This leads me to the instructional CD included. The CD does make some helpful remarks, however, one thing I strongly suggest they include is the correct motion to apply the wax generously and create the &#34;tab&#34; at the end. I had to go to youtube to watch some tutorials, which by the way, all used the rounded wax applicator sticks (the ones that look just like popsicle sticks), to understand how to do it correctly. I think with rounded applicator sticks and practice, lots of practice, I won't have trouble doing my own waxing. Overall these are my only 2 complaints with this product.<br /><br />I'm going to a salon professional to correct my half- done wax job, but I'm certainly not done with this waxing kit. After buying new wax applicator sticks I'll give it another shot.

It does a great job, pain is minimal, easy to get precisely where you want it and its not messy to clean up. For me, I find preloaded cold wax strips like completely bare hypo-allergenic strips work well, goes quickly and minimizes discomfort. I hate with a passion cream wax b/c it is so messy and I always run out of strips. In my opinion is also hurts more.<br /><br />All in all, this kit was exactly as promised and this is the best stuff around for a great bikini and underarm wax I have found.

Everyone is different but laser treatments can permanently remove your hair in about 12 sessions. I could not stop saying &#34;oh my - , oh my - &#34; I was having to yell something just to get through one pull of the wax.   372. I've had many waxes in my life and FINALLY decided that I was tired of spending a ton of money on it and that I could do this myself. The eyebrow wax, for me, had a learning curve b/c I was scared I was going to take all my eyebrows off. That said, after a couple of tries, I got it (brows in tact!!). My bikini area was actually a breeze. Yes, it still hurt, but I've been waxed a lot, I've tried an epilator (never again!!), and I've shaved. THIS is the only way for me now. No ugly shaving bumps this way! I actually prefer to do it myself and honestly, it doesn't hurt as badly as when someone else does it! Watch the DVD if you don't know what you're doing, well even if you do, it's best to refresh. My pointers (which are similar to the others but I find the more I read similar reviews, the more likely it is for me to actually take the tips and make my decision):<br /><br />1. Keep it on high for 15-20 min then turn it down to low (I left it on high accidentally for about an hour then had to turn it off for 20 min to get it to the thickness I wanted. (THIN AND DRIPPY IS NOT WHAT YOU WANT)<br />2. Hence this tip- keep it thick.<br />3. Take a couple of Ibuprofen 30 minutes prior to bikini or underarm wax (eyebrow waxing doesn't hurt me at all so I don't take any if I'm just doing brows).<br />4. Make absolute sure to use the pre-oil and don't worry about using too much.<br />5. Extend the waxing area an inch or so each time to be able to lift the corner of the wax up to rip off. You can start lifting the corner as soon as you cover the area you want, just wait to rip until it's not sticky.<br />6. Also, the clean collars are great to keep the top of the warmer area clean.<br /><br />Great purchase, easy, mess-free. Maybe I missed my calling as an esthetician.

  383. I have never had anything waxed, let alone wax anything myself so I am a complete beginner to the process. So enticed by the promise of smooth feeling skin for days I decided to give it a try, it seemed to me a good price. Being newbie I started by attempting my underarms. I had looked through the reviews and decided that I would use this with muslin strips as that seemed to really ease the removal and speed things up. I plugged in the heater and put the wax in and my only slight complaint was that it took a LONG time to fully melt (~ 1 hr at least). I imagine this is because the wax container was filled to the top and that it is actually a lot of wax to melt. But, once the wax was ready to go, it was smooth sailing (no pun intended). I turned the wax warmer to medium, used the pre-epilation oil and then dusted with baby powder as a waxing prep. The first underarm took me maybe half an hour but by the time I did my second under arm I had a whole system down and I was done in five minutes. I applied wax starting at the top of my underarm in about 1 inch strips, I had a number of muslin strips set out ahead of time and proceeded to wax in consecutive 1 inch strips. Done in no time! There were a couple of loose hairs that I plucked but was super impressed by how effective the wax was in conjunction with use of the muslin strips. The pain was mild but I have a high tolerance for pain. After 15 minutes, my underarms felt totally back to normal and were smoother than I've ever seen! Would highly recommend this product for someone that things they can take some brief pain for the benefit of smooth, smooth hairless skin. It is now 3 days later and I can't believe how great my underarms still look and feel. I will definitely be wearing more sleeveless tops this summer!

  403. Before buying this I had only ever gone into a salon to get waxed. I bought this because financially it wasn't within my budget to shell out $60 a month for a Brazilian. The instructional video helps, but be warned it's definitely NSFW and should probably be watched in private. I prefer hard wax like this over wax strips, it's easier to remove and doesn't stick to your skin. I bought this from Amazon for about $30. I saw this same kit at Sally's Beauty Supply for $85. Needless to say, I'm super happy I found it for such a great price. I've used this about 4 times now and I've still got plenty of wax, and about half the amount of (large) sticks that came with it. Not bad if you ask me. I'll be able to use this at least 4 more times before I need to buy any replacement supplies. That's at least 8 Brazilian waxes, which would have cost me $480 total in salons, for only $30. F*** yeah!<br />If this is your first time ever waxing on your own, here's a few tips: Give yourself ample time; it is NOT easy to rip wax off a sensitive area on your own. I usually take about 45-1hr because I let myself relax for a bit after removing each piece of wax, and sometimes I need to give myself extra time to breathe before pulling. Make sure you're somewhere you can fully lay down. It helps. Be sure to lay something down under you and around the warmer to prevent getting wax on any surface. I prefer to use a paper bag that's been cut to lay flat because 1. I have a ton of those around the apt so it doesn't cost me anything, 2. it protects the area from getting wax on it, and 3. I can easily throw it away when I'm done. Buena suerte!

If you can do it better or the same as your beautician why go somewhere else, just get this kit and do it at home. This will save you tons of money! Overall, great product and I highly recommend it to anyone thinking of doing the procedure in the comfort of their own home.

  415. I have received and used the waxing kit this past Monday. First time user of waxing and I used it for my underarms. I did have the help of my husband which was a plus. It was simple to apply and may have taken a few minutes for the wax to harden enough to strip the hair out. My tolerance of pain is fairly high, so it didn't bother me too much and I didn't take any Motrin or Tylenol beforehand.   418. When I did it, it wasn't painful.<br /><br />1. Heated the wax for about 25 minutes on HIGH and then switched it to LOW to keep it warm.<br />2. Cleaned the area with alcohol pads (rubbing alcohol will do)<br />2.5- rubbed hands with baby oil to keep wax from sticking- it gets messy if your first time.<br />3. Rubbed the area with a bit of baby powder to keep the wax from sticking.<br />4. Applied a little bit (like one/two drops) of Pre-Epi oil (supplied) on the area and rubbed.<br />5. Applied wax with applicator in direction of hair growth and made sure it was not too thin (applied about twice over).<br />6. Made sure the wax was tacky and pulled really fast opposite of hair growth and then use the wax strip to pick up any residue.<br /><br />Didn't hurt since I have plucked and I find plucking much more torturous.<br />Great product, love the hard wax as opposed to getting muslin strips.
  419. I was going on a tropical vacation and I am not comfortable going to a professional bikini waxer so I bought this kit to do it at home.   428. I wish someone had informed me of the benefits of waxing many years ago. I love it! I am now very adept at waxing my upper lip and eyebrows, and they don't even stay red for very long. Waxing is something you have to get the feel for. You have to know when the wax is hot enough, but not too hot. It must be runny enough to lock in all the hairs, but not too runny that it goes on too hot and thin. You do not want to burn your skin. I am a 33 year old woman. I've been shaving my upper lip since I was about 13.<br />I received this kit and on the first try, I literally ripped off some hair and a lot of skin! Use the pre-wax oil, at least for your first 5-10 times. I also put chapstick on my lips very thinly, so any stray wax wouldn't rip my thin, sensitive lip skin off. The Post Wax Cooling Gel is GREAT! It burns for a second, then starts to feel great! Turn your face towards a fan or blowing A/C, that helps with really rough sessions.<br />It took a month of waxing my upper lip, giving it 3-4 days to heal, waxing again, waiting again. It took exactly 30 days for my upper lip to actually feel completely smooth! Now it's like I'm learning to kiss again! I used to keep my upper lip far away, because I knew how it felt if a lip rubbed it the wrong way. Now, I literally have nothing to worry about! Feels smooth, silky, and even when the hairs start growing back, they are thin and soft! I love it!

It is seriously an art to get the perfect temperature as to not leave the wax behind, nor burn yourself, and have successful hair removal. I spoke with a close friend, who IS a professional and she laughed, then said the instructions are actually a little off. BEWARE. Do not let the wax set too long on your body, or it will not come off!! And by too long, I am talking even one second too long.<br /><br />Other than that, I did not have the issue of the wax not heating up enough - it does take several hours for the entire tub to melt, but, just plan ahead and it is not a problem.<br /><br />Oh, and this did not come with the epliating strips. I ordered those separately (by Gigi) - again, timing is everything and the wax would not even adhere to the strip if it was off at all.   446. I've been looking for a new waxing kit since Bliss raised the price of their Poetic Waxing kit by an unreasonable amount. I saw the good ratings for the GiGi Brazilian Waxing Kit and decided to give it a try. I'm glad that I did! Not only was the GiGi kit nearly half the price as the Bliss kit, you receive three/four times more wax. When I first saw the wax I was a bit hesitant because I thought that the waxing might hurt more. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the GiGi wax hurt a lot less. It's also easier to keep the wax at a constant temperature and the heating mechanism does not overheat the wax (like the microwave can do with the Bliss wax). The only cons were 1. it does take longer to heat up the wax (about 45 mins for a full container) and 2. it's not as effective on shorter stubble. But the price and ease of waxing has won me over!

The only faults I can find with this kit are that the warmer, even on the low setting, keeps the wax a bit too warm for me so I had to swirl the stick in mid air for a bit until it cooled down so I can apply, and I wish it came with more wax collars and a wax off oil. But for the price I am satisfied with the product.<br /><br />The wax itself is excellent. I like it more than the Nad's hard wax I tried before this because it was easier to flick the edge of the wax upward to pull it off and it didn't break off as much when pulling. I think it removed more hair also, but that probably has to do with the nice pre-epilation oil included. I didn't use much at all. The bottle will last a long while. I just didn't feel that it added as much as an oil to remove stray wax would. The dvd has some useful advice for beginners.

  450. I have really coarse hair &#34;down there&#34; and have tried soo many different hair removal products, all of them resulting in nothing but painful horror stories. This wax WORKS, and it works well, as long as you take the time to learn how to use it the correct way. I cannot emphasize enough the importance of taking the time to lean the correct skills and techniques. I spent a lot of time reading reviews and watching youtube videos on how to use hard wax, and it spared me the frustration and sticky messes other people experienced.<br /><br />I have never removed all of the hair from my bikini area before, and I have to admit, I'm doing little sections every few days instead of everything all at once. After I've done so much waxing, the entire area gets very tender and sore and I just prefer giving my skin a break. Once the hair starts growing back in and its thinner I'll be able to do it all in one shot. It is extremely painful removing all of the hair for the first time, but this is to be expected.<br /><br />Here are a few tips and things I've learned along the way:<br />-Before doing anything with the wax, watch the video that comes with the kit. Taking the time to do this will spare you sticky messes and an unsuccessful experience.<br />-ALWAYS take ibuprofen about an hour before waxing. It will still be extremely painful, but slightly less so than if you were to wax without it. You may also need to take it the day after waxing. Your skin will be tender for a few days, and quite possibly bruised if you are doing a full brazilian.<br />-To heat up the wax, turn the warmer on high for approximately 15 minutes, and then to low. I have never waited for the wax to completely melt before beginning. Personally, I prefer the thicker texture the wax has when its still melting in the middle.<br />-The wax is so much easier to use when it is on the thick side. This helps to prevent dripping when you are spreading the wax and makes it easier to spread and keep it only where you want it.<br />-Use the pre epilation oil, but not too much. Not using it opens up the door to ripping your skin off along with your hair and using too much could prevent the wax from properly adhering to your hair.<br />-When applying the wax, spread it evenly (in the direction of your hair growth) and DO NOT spread out the edges. You want the wax to be about an eighth of an inch thick in the middle and thicker on the edges. I learned from watching videos that this helps to maintain the structure of the wax and will prevent leftover bits from sticking to your skin when you rip it off.<br />-If you are using the wax for the first time, make sure you practice on your legs or arms first. You DO NOT want to learn on your bikini area; this could easily result in painful mistakes and lots of sticky wax in areas you really do not want it to be.<br />-Remove excess bits of wax with baby oil, and do this while the wax is still slightly soft. Once it is hard, the only thing you can do is pick at it or rip out the hair that it is sticking to.<br />-A few people mentioned that they strain and reuse their wax. This is tempting because it saves money, however I would not recommend it. Doing this can promote bacterial growth in your wax, and you DO NOT want this to happen. Freshly waxed skin is extremely prone to infection, so keeping your supplies and tools clean and sanitary is incredibly important. The last thing you want is to end up in the hospital with an infection because you were not keeping your supplies sanitary.<br />-Inform yourself about how to care for post waxed skin before beginning. Like I said, freshly waxed skin is extremely prone to infection, and it needs to be taken care of properly.<br /><br />All that being said, I really do love this product. I am SO excited that I've finally found something that works and works well. Buying the kit was especially handy, and the warmer is so much better than going back and forth between the bathroomand the microwave. Even though the wax is mean specifically for coarse hair, I have used it on my upper lip and eyebrows with success. It is significantly less painful that the wax strips I typically use.<br /><br />I would most definitely recommend this kit to anyone who prefers waxing in the comfort of your home and is patient enough to take the time to learn to use this product properly.
  451. Works great just read and research on how to use it first to keep from getting burned. This is not a plug and play item. It does take some common sense to keep from getting hurt. Do the homework. You'll be glad you did.
  452. Great price, great quality, fast shipping. I had never waxed before, and researched like crazy before purchasing this kit. The hard wax is awesome! Yes, waxing hurts, some areas more than others, but this hard wax does not stick to your skin, just the hair, so that helps reduce the pain of waxing in general. I got better results without using the oil, it seems the wax doesn't stick to the skin anyways, and the oil sometimes makes the wax not stick to the hair. I recommend buying some oral numbing stuff, like a dentist uses and not any of the \\"waxing\\" specific stuff they sell, it doesn't work as well and is over priced. Go with this kit if you are looking for a great quality and complete waxing kit for all areas of the body. Highly recommended!

  457. I had my first-ever waxing experience 2 weeks ago using the wax strips on just my legs and that was pretty painful. Then she did my lip with the strips and that was really quick and pretty painless. Afterward I did some research and found out about hard wax. I read everything I could find about it and decided to purchase this kit because of the helpful reviews and it was so much cheaper than what it would have cost to buy in store around town. I am SO GLAD I decided to buy this kit! It lives up to all the other great reviews and I couldn't be happier with it. I am pretty impatient and a quick learner, so when the package arrived yesterday I decided to watch the DVD which was informative, then I decided to try the brazillian wax on myself. Let me first state that I wouldn't recommend that if you don't have a have a high pain tolerance. I do, so I thought I'd give it a shot. Mind you I have NEVER had even a bikini wax. But the whole experience went better than I imagined! I put the collar on the wax jar and warmed it on high until it was about 50% melted. Then I stirred a little because the edges warm first, then let it melt some more. I turned it to medium once it was about 85% melted, stirred and tested it on my wrist. Not only was this good for temperature, but I put enough on to make a little strip and got some practice waiting the right amount of time before flicking up an end and ripping off. I did that 3 times and by that point was very confident I could do this. I washed and dried the area while the wax melted, rubbed in less than a dime size of the pre-epilation oil and wiped off the excess, then started the wax. I started with the bigger applicator stick but I don't recommend that unless you've had this area waxed before. I soon switched to the medium size stick and did smaller areas (like so many others had suggested in the first place!) and that felt a lot better! I also took some advice I read online and coughed while I ripped off the wax. It distracts from the pain, and about midway through the waxing I knew which spots I would need to do that for and which were not as sensitive, as coughing for every single pull can get annoying! I found that the lower abdomen hair was MUCH more painful to pull out than those further down or on the sides. Little dots of blood are normal as you are ripping out very thick hair; just keep a paper towel on hand and blot (don't wipe!) as needed. After I was done I put the gigi cooling gel on a cotton ball and GENTLY rubbed that all over the waxed areas. It was very cool and soothing. There is a tutorial I found that was extrememly informative and really made me want to buy my own kit and try it: [...] I'm so excited about the amount of money I'll save doing this myself and how easy it turned out to be. Another important note: because the wax only adheres to the hair and not the skin, I found it very helpful to be able to wax areas more than once to remove the few hairs that didn't come out the first time around. If you do not have a high pain tolerance and have never waxed before, I would recommend trying the legs first! If you've done that but have never done a bikini or brazillian before I would strongly recommend starting with the bikini and seeing how that goes first. Bye bye razor!!! Happy waxing :)

  497. Heat seems like it's difficult to manage -- sometimes it's a perfect, &#34;thick honey&#34; consistency at medium or high, and sometimes even on low it's completely liquid hot and burns to the touch. Also takes much longer to heat up and melt than the instructions say -- they say &#34;20 mins to half hour on high&#34; but I've learned to just turn it on and leave it for closer to an hour before even checking, and a lot of the time there will still be a solid wax chunk in the middle (but the melted parts on the sides are still workable). The slider also is a little bit hard to work with, since it will slide back slightly from where you leave it, which also seems like it makes it very hard to turn &#34;off&#34; ? It will always slide back nearer to the &#34;low&#34; setting and turn the light back on. Not a big deal since you can always unplug it.<br /><br />Definitely keeps the wax liquid though, has never hardened too much or turned solid again while on. Will just take some playing around with the heat settings and turning it off sometimes to keep it right. Would have given 5 stars if the heater itself was more consistent and easier to manage.<br />Also not sure if it was some kind of coincidence, but I got much better results the times I used it WITHOUT the pre epilation oil. Even using very little it seemed like it made the wax less likely to stick to my hair as well, and when using no oil at all I never had any issues with the wax sticking too much to my skin, and the pain seemed the same.<br /><br />Depending on the consistency you use it at, the wax is VERY messy -- either leaves thin &#34;hairs&#34; of wax from the pot to wherever you're putting it no matter how much you wipe it off, or just straight up drips, but it does dry hard so it's easy to pick off of anything it lands on later.<br /><br />As for the waxing itself, it's mostly trial and error to figure out what works for you and your hair/skin, but this is definitely a good kit to learn since you don't have to be worrying about manually reheating your wax and can take your time and relax.have to be worrying about manually reheating your wax and can take your time and relax.

I've used it on my legs and armpits as well and I am still shocked how much this does not hurt. The key to the hard wax is to be generous and let it set on your hair long enough. Too little wax and you won't be able to pull it off. Flick up the edge, then grab hold of it firmly and pull. Works like a charm.<br /><br />Although I'm too chicken, I have used this to give my partner a Brazilian and she was in heaven.   530. I'm really pleased that I finally caved in and bought this wax warmer. I've used Gigi products in the past, but would just buy those little microwave containers, thinking, &#34;Oh, I'm not a salon, I'm not fancy like that. I don't need a fancy contraption dedicated just to waxing...&#34; The problem with those little microwave kits is that towards the last fifth of the container, the waxes get all crusty and don't heat properly. You also waste a lot of time stopping the process to get up and reheat the wax again and again. This warmer's constant temperature is worth it: it's very convenient AND saves money.<br /><br />The wax it comes with it amazing. The formulation adheres strictly to the No Hair Left Behind Act. It's a stripless wax, which means you spread it on and then rip off just the wax itself. However, sometimes it's difficult to get the strip started and you're left with these little bits stuck to your hand. If you're really quick, you can get a fabric strip on top of the wax before it cools. The benefit of using a strip is you can also manage to wax a larger/longer area in one go. Without a strip, you need to work in short 1/2 to 1 1/2 inch areas. It's probably better to learn the stripless method (economically and ecologically speaking).<br /><br />The downside to this wax's amazing sticking power is that it likes to leave teeny, tiny little sticky remnants all over. Sugar waxes spoil you with how easy they are to clean up: just wash away! With this stuff, you'll think you've gotten all of it off and then find weird little lint-spots on your skin later that day. Not especially great when you've just waxed your face and then you have a cotton ball fuzz mustache.<br /><br />One thing I don't like about the kit is that, as with every other Gigi waxing kit, it recommends using the Pre-Hon cleanser. Unlike every other Gigi waxing kit, it does not come with said cleanser. It also does not come with the Slow-Grow treatment for after waxing.
  531. I have tried other at home waxing kits before (soft wax, never hard wax like this product) and cannot believe how easy this product made the wax. The DVD that accompanies the product gives very clear instructions on how the wax should be applied and removed. After only a few test strips I was able to get the process down pretty well. This might not replace my monthly waxing routine, but will absolutely come in handy in a pinch when I don't have time to get to the waxer. I highly recommend this product, and as a waxing veteran can tell you that this experience was fairly painless!

  547. This is the best wax I have ever used and definitely triumphs anything I have bought from a retail store. After waxing, my legs stayed smooth for nearly a whole month, as opposed to shaving which lasts me only a few days. It's a very simple (and yes, even relaxing) process once you get the hang of it and the DVD does include a few helpful tips. I have found it's important not to overheat the wax, as this makes it harder to work with and much messier. To avoid that problem, I never set the temperature above Medium and this keeps it at a nice consistency. The smallest sticks included are great for eyebrows; I cut the end of the stick at an angle for easier application. This is an awesome kit for anyone considering at home waxing, and I will definitely be ordering the refills to have on hand.

  566. The warmer works, if anything too well. I followed the directions for how long to leave on high before turning to low and I think it was too long and the wax was a little too hot so it was not thick enough. For future uses, I think I will watch it more closely and when there is only a small amount of unmelted wax left in the middle, turn it to low. I had great results when I applied the wax properly and at the right temp. Other places I had some hair breakage but mostly where I applied the wax too hot/thin.<br /><br />I recommend trying it on an easier spot first, I did the tops of my feet and my big toe which insist on growing fuzzy hairs. Standard bikini was not too bad. Going for the Brazilian is a little more difficult. I wouldn't recommend a sphynx on first try unless you have someone to help you. You almost need three hands, two to pull the skin taut from top and bottom, and one to yank off the wax. If you aren't used to waxing yourself, it is going to take some time and there will be some mistakes which up the pain level such as wax too warm/thin or waiting too long to pull off. You'll be tired of messing with it before you finish and the top and center are the harder and more painful areas. The worst are when you can't end your wax strip in a hairless spot and don't have a good &#34;tab&#34; to pull with because you can't get enough of the wax up to get a grip without pulling on the hair its attached to. I wish I had read more of the reviews before starting, I think the tips about putting a piece of hard wax on top to act as a pull tab will help a lot. If you've never had a wax, get a professional to do the first one. The first one hurts the most and its easier to let someone else inflict the pain rather than do it yourself. You'll also learn a lot about how it should be done. My waxer is great and I can be in and out in less than a half hour and no discomfort once she's done.bout how it should be done. There as no pain in the outer regions and split second moments of pain in the inner regions. It took two hours without any mess, as long as you follow the instructions and prepare your area properly. I also read reviews on this product before purchasing it and there are many helpful tips such as taking a warm shower before waxing. The shower helps cleanse the area and softens the skin and the heat from the warm shower opens the pores; this significantly reduces the level of pain you might experience. I also watched other at-home Brazilian wax videos which helped with knowing where to place the wax and the amount as well as the technique and angle. To be more precise, the level of pain for the inner region is similar to taking off a stubborn band-aid; the pain is instantaneous and fades into numbness after a few seconds of applied pressure. It's so much easier on your skin. I could wax my brows and walk right out of my house without any red puffy skin. If you've never used hard wax or have never waxed your bikini area, this product has very good instructions. The directions on how to apply the oil and how to heat the wax are extremely important, so pay close attention to those. If you put too much oil on, you will miss a lot of hairs. As for the heating of the wax, not following instructions can lead to burns, so beware. It's a long process, but worth it, so I usually begin to warm the wax a few hours before I need it, that way it can fully melt and then be turned down to reach a comfortable waxing temperature. I found the video included quite useful as a first time bikini waxer, and was able to avoid any horror stories I've heard over the years. I've only used this product twice, each time to do a full bikini area wax, and my brows, and it looks like I've hardly used any wax. I'm expecting to get about 15-20 waxings out of this kit.

  595. Having always been too shy to visit the salon, this is my only method of getting a Brazilian wax. I was happy to read so many positive reviews on this product before purchasing, and am also happy to give my own praises.<br /><br />My tips:<br />1) Start the warmer on high, but as soon as the wax has a 0.25&#34; ring of melted wax around it, flip the remainder unmelted wax, and turn the warmer down to low. The residual heat will continue melting the wax, and you won't burn yourself with scorching hot wax.<br />2) Apply a generous amount. Not only is it easier to grab onto to remove, but for some reason, it also cools more reliably and doesn't flake off like some thinner layers do.<br />3) Definitely watch the DVD that comes with the kit and do your research online - you do NOT want to attempt a home wax without advice.

  641. At first, I thought I can make this product work for me. But after two painful attempts, I decided I hated this product. However, I felt like this product can only work for people who are really experienced with wax. I've never waxed before and I found this whole process to be way too time-consuming and not very efficient.<br /><br />The positives:<br />-The price is good<br />-The value is good<br />-If you're experienced with wax, this would work well for you<br /><br />The negatives:<br />-Extremely time-consuming<br />-Messy<br />-Will ruin your bathroom floor and your manicure unless you put towels all over the floors and wear a pair of gloves<br />-Painful, irritates the skin<br />-Hurt my back really badly -- I had to sit on the floor leaning forward and my back was killing me afterwards<br /><br />I feel like I also need to let other people know about one mistake I made, It's IMPORTANT that your heat your wax to a right temperature. Notice how the instructions say you need to warm the wax on high setting for 20-30 minutes first and then leave it on the low setting for a while. Don't ignore this instruction. When I tried waxing first time, I followed the instruction, and my wax had the perfect consistency. It was relatively easy to apply to skin and it wasn't dripping everywhere. It was just right. The second time I made a mistake of leaving the wax on high setting, and then on medium setting. As a result, the wax was too hot and drippy. It was hard to apply to skin and it was dripping everywhere. Make sure your temperature is right, so your wax can have the correct consistency.<br /><br />Unfortunately for me, even after realizing the mistake I have made, I was sick enough of dealing with this whole process I decided it just wasn't worth the time and the effort. You see, the pain issue is not that important to me, I can tough it up when I really want to. However, the time and the effectiveness of a product are important to me. I refuse to spend three hours on waxing one area. It's absurd. I have ordered an epilator instead.<br /><br />UPDATE:<br />WARNING!!! I put the towels, which I used to protect the bathroom floor from wax, in the dryer after I washed them. The wax got all over my dryer. It comes off but it takes long time to clean up.   651. The best waxing kit I have ever used. Save the money on having it professionally done and do it in the comforts of your own home. Worth it over and over!
  652. This kit really has everything you need. Make sure you read the directions, and if you're doing this for the first time, do yourself a favor and watch some videos on how to do it properly. The pre-wax oil was great, though I wasn't a fan of the cooling gel. It made the area burn. I applied my old time favorite Bag Balm to my bikini area for a few days as a precaution and everything was fine. The wax itself is very easy to use. I laughed at the picture where the girl had wax all over her fingers. I'm honestly not sure how that happens. This was my first time doing this and it was pretty simple. Just warm up the wax at max temp for about 25 minutes, and then turn to the lowest setting and let it cool for another 5-10 minutes. This leaves the wax at just the right consistency so it's not too runny that it will drip all over and it's not too thick that you will have trouble applying it due to it being too sticky. Make sure you also put the collar on the wax can before you put it in the warmer. It will prevent little drips from getting all over the warmer and can be reused as many times as you like. You also get plenty of applicators. I only used two throughout, and only had to replace the first one because I set it down for too long and it hardened.<br /><br />I was worried at first that this unit would be a hazard for the little ones, and while it should never be left unattended with children around, I felt comfortable getting ready in the bathroom with them around because the unit is not hot to the touch. It gets pretty warm, but not warm enough to cause injury by any means. You just need to be vigilant that little hands don't go exploring. It also took some time to cool, during which I just locked the bathroom door for the 10-15 minutes before I cleaned it up. Overall, I'm really pleased with the results (a week later I still have clean, smooth under arms with no shadow of stubble at all and my bikini area is also smooth with no irritation that shaving always causes) and it was really very simple to use. For someone who has never done anything like this, it went very well with no mishaps. Just make sure you test your skin before starting. I had no adverse reactions and I have very sensitive skin, but you never know. Also, be very careful using this on areas with &#34;thin&#34; skin, such as on stretch marks, breasts, etc. I didn't try, but this was one big no-no I heard repeatedly.and it was really very simple to use. For someone who has never done anything like this, it went very well with no mishaps. Just make sure you test your skin before starting. I had no adverse reactions and I have very sensitive skin, but you never know. Also, be very careful using this on areas with &#34;thin&#34; skin, such as on stretch marks, breasts, etc. I didn't try, but this was one big no-no I heard repeatedly.
